Package game

Class Border

java.lang.Object
game.Border
All Implemented Interfaces:
Element
public class Border extends Object implements Element
The Border class represents a border element in the game, which is a polygonal shape used to define the boundaries of the game environment. Borders are typically used to prevent game objects from moving beyond certain limits. This class extends the Polygon class and implements the Element interface, allowing it to be rendered and interacted with in the game.
Author:
Tong Zhan, Hayden Wong.

    • Border

      public Border(Point[] inShape, Point inPosition, double inRotation)
      Constructs a Border object with the specified shape, position, and rotation.
      Parameters:
      inShape - An array of points defining the shape of the border.
      inPosition - The position of the border in the game world.
      inRotation - Not used in this game; ignored.

    • collides

      public boolean collides(game.Polygon other)
      Checks if the current polygon collides with another polygon. * * This method determines whether any point of the current polygon lies within the boundaries of the specified polygon 'other', indicating a collision between the two polygons.
      Parameters:
      other - The polygon with which collision detection is being performed.
      Returns:
      true if a collision is detected, false otherwise.
